metadata.title: CVE-2022-40302 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in bgpd in FRRouting (FRR) through 8.4. By craftinga BGP OPEN message with an option of type 0xff (Extended Length from RFC9072), attackers may cause a denial of service (assertion failure anddaemon restart, or out-of-bounds read). This is possible because ofinconsistent boundary checks that do not account for reading 3 bytes(instead of 2) in this 0xff case.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40302` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-pythontools - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-snmp - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2').
